page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: FOUR OF THE VILLAGES HAVE A BUS SERVICE. THE ROUTE FROM MIDDLESBROUGH TO LINGDALE PASSES THROUGH SLAPEWATH, CHARLTON AND MARGROVE PARK, AND THE SCARBOROUGH BUS PASSES THROUGH STANGHOW. THE SERVICE TO LINGDALE IS HALF HOURLY AT PEAK TIMES, BUT LESS FREQUENT IN THE EVENINGS AND ON SUNDAYS. THE SERVICE TO STANGHOW IS LIMITED. PEOPLE ARE CONCERNED AT THE EFFECT OF PRIVATIZATION ON SERVICES AND ON CONCESSIONARY FARES, WHICH APPLY TO THE UNEMPLOYED AND ELDERLY. BUSES ARE WELL USED. CARS ARE USED BY LESS THAN A THIRD OF THE POPULATION, AND MANY OF THE CARS IN USE ARE OLD.MOST PEOPLE IN STANGHOW AND AYSDALE GATE HAVE ACCESS TO A CAR, BECAUSE OF THE LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT.
